Young Sikh Professionals Network (YSPN)

The Young Sikh Professionals Network (YSPN) is an Australia/New Zealand based professional networking organisations which aims to engender a sense of belief within the Sikh diaspora that they can achieve exceptional success within Australia.

Overview

YSPN’s mission is to “create the conditions for young Sikh professionals to succeed and amplify their influence”. YSPN delivers its mandate by hosting marquee events to inspire young Sikh professionals; workshops focussed on professional skills development; mentoring programs to create intergenerational personal connections; produces and curates content to promote a positive and productive image of Sikhs; and advocates establishing stronger networks amongst the broader community.
  • YSPN holds events across each of its chapters in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth and Auckland focussed on providing young Sikh professionals the opportunity to network, learn from experienced executives and learn important professional skills. YSPN aims to deliver 4 events per city per year, and till date has delivered ~50 events
  • YSPN also administers a mentoring program in each city, connecting tenured professionals with young professionals and University students
  • YSPN produces content and advocates on behalf of Sikhs, focussed on improving the productive and intellectual image of Sikhs

Volunteer

YSPN has a management team of ~50 volunteers who help prepare events, run marketing, deliver the mentoring program, produce content and manage the operations of the organisation.

Sikh Youth Australia was formed in 1996, and has been a progressive, national organization enriching the lives of Australian Sikh youth and their families by empowering them to understand and enjoy their identity & contribute positively to the social and economic development of Australia.
